section.title: Changing the Password for the Internal Administrative User
section.para: To reset the password of the internal administrative user (admin@internal), use the ovirt-aaa-jdbc-tool tool. You do not need to restart the ovirt-engine service for the password change to take effect.

By default, the password policy for user accounts on the internal domain has the following restrictions:
A minimum of 6 characters.
Three previous passwords used cannot be set again during the password change.
For more information on the password policy and other default settings, run ovirt-aaa-jdbc-tool settings show.

procedure.title: Resetting the Password for the Internal Administrative User

step.para: Log in to the machine on which the Red Hat Virtualization Manager is installed.

To change the password in interactive mode, run the following command. You must set a value for --password-valid-to, otherwise the password expiry time defaults to the current time. The date format is yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ssX. In this example, Z stands for UTC time. For more options, run ovirt-aaa-jdbc-tool user password-reset --help. # ovirt-aaa-jdbc-tool user password-reset admin --password-valid-to="2025-08-01 12:00:00Z"
